headline.main: THE JAPANESE HOMEWARD BOUND; Arrival of the Niagara on the Coast of Africa. Occupations, Resources, Amusements, Habits, Practices, Devices, Curiosity and Ingenuity of the Japs Their Devotion to Gin Cock-talis and how they Acquired the Art of Making Them, The Capers and Caprices of Tommy He Indulges in Poetry. Great African Outburst at St. Paul de Loando. NEWS FROM THE AFRICAN SQUADRON. From Another Correspondent.

docs.lead_paragraph: I wrote last from St. Vincents, in the Cape de Verdes, from where we sailed on the 18th ult. We crossed the Equator in longitude 1 East, passed the solitary island of Annabona on the 3lst, and now find ourselves deep within the Gulf of Guinea. in Africa, the sandy shores and barren country dimly visible from the deck, while the sea around us is of a dirty junk bottle greenish hue, caused

docs.snippet: The regular monthly meeting of the Chamber of Commerce was held yesterday afternoon at the rooms of that body. There was a large attendance of members. The President, PELATIAH PERIT, Esq., occupied the Chair.

docs.snippet: By the steamer Osceola, which arrived yesterday at Batabano from Truxillo, we have received letters which give us an account of the tragical end of the great fillibuster. we insert them below; and it is highly satisfactory to note the Christian death...

headline.main: THE DEATH OF WALKER.; Full Particulars of his Trial and Exccution His Dying Speech, his Confession and his Piety. ANOTHER ACCOUTN.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the steamer Osceola, which arrived yesterday at Batabano from Truxillo, we have received letters which give us an account of the tragical end of the great fillibuster. we insert them below; and it is highly satisfactory to note the Christian death of the celebrated fillibuster. It is a great pity that a man capable of such sentiments should have led a life during which he caused so many disasters to humanity.

docs.snippet: The United States Mail steamship Cahawba, J. W. SMITH, Commander, arrived at this port yesterday morning at 6 o'clock, having left New-Orleans on the 25th ult. at 8 A.M., reaching Havana on the evening of the 27th at 8 P.M., from whence she took her...

headline.main: From Havana.; ARRIVAL OF THE CAHAWBA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship Cahawba, J. W. SMITH, Commander, arrived at this port yesterday morning at 6 o'clock, having left New-Orleans on the 25th ult. at 8 A.M., reaching Havana on the evening of the 27th at 8 P.M., from whence she took her departure for New-York at noon on the 28th.

docs.snippet: THE NEW SEVENTH REGIMENT ARMORY. Last evening the new Seventh Regiment Armory, comprising the second and third floors of the new Tompkins Market, was occupied for the first time, to any extent,  and thrown open for public inspection. Although by  no...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE NEW SEVENTH REGIMENT ARMORY. Last evening the new Seventh Regiment Armory, comprising the second and third floors of the new Tompkins Market, was occupied for the first time, to any extent, and thrown open for public inspection. Although by no means finished, the rooms already show how great will be the improvement upon the old quarters.

docs.snippet: drama, "of Irish character and construction," as the bills phrase it, was produced, last night, at this popular establishment. It is founded on one of CARLETON'S charming tales, in his "Traits and Sketches of the Irish Peasantry."

docs.snippet: Our correspondent at Vera Cruz, announces the increase of the American squadron in the Gulf of Mexico, and regards this as an indication that the Government of the United States is now earnestly determined to prevent the interference of Spain in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Our correspondent at Vera Cruz, announces the increase of the American squadron in the Gulf of Mexico, and regards this as an indication that the Government of the United States is now earnestly determined to prevent the interference of Spain in the affairs of Mexico.
